intro: Athanasia cochlearifolia, commonly known as the spiral bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive spiral arrangement of leaves and its bell-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of blue and purple. The plant belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It thrives in full sun and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. Athanasia cochlearifolia is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
